meanings.definition: A small piece or quantity of something
meanings.sent1: She picked up a bitos of chocolate from the table.
meanings.sent2: The artist added a bitos of red paint to the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The tiny squirrel carried a bitos of acorn up the tree.
meanings.sent4: His heart shattered into bitos when she said goodbye.
meanings.sent5: The sunlit room was filled with bitos of dust floating in the air.

meanings.sent1: Wait just a bitos, I'll be right back.
meanings.sent2: In a bitos, the bus will arrive at the stop.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the rabbit disappear for a bitos.
meanings.sent4: The laughter echoed through the room for a bitos.
meanings.sent5: The storm passed in a bitos, leaving behind a rainbow.

meanings.definition: To take a small bite of food
meanings.sent1: She likes to bitos into a juicy apple for a snack.
meanings.sent2: The kids eagerly bitos into the freshly baked cookies.
meanings.sent3: He pretended to bitos into the plastic fruit as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The puppy would always bitos at the corners of the sandwich.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully watched as the food critic bitos into the dish.

meanings.definition: To cut or wound with a sharp instrument
meanings.sent1: The tailor needed to bitos the fabric to make it fit.
meanings.sent2: The sword bitos through the enemy's armor effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally bitos her finger while chopping vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The sharp claws bitos deep into the tree bark.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor carefully bitos away at the marble to reveal the statue within.
